body_html:
@weiliu620 @joshburkart
I have tried the L-BFGS method in the neural-art code by @jcjohnson .
It does work and return more stable results than Adam.
However, I find the optimization became a little slower.

Also, is there any way to probe at iteration progress (print stuff / generate checkpoint images using interval variables) like the original code does.
Since I find in the official comment doc that "variables subject to optimization are updated in-place at the end of optimization".
body_text:
@weiliu620 @joshburkart
I have tried the L-BFGS method in the neural-art code by @jcjohnson .
It does work and return more stable results than Adam.
However, I find the optimization became a little slower.
Also, is there any way to probe at iteration progress (print stuff / generate checkpoint images using interval variables) like the original code does.
Since I find in the official comment doc that "variables subject to optimization are updated in-place at the end of optimization".
body:
@weiliu620 @joshburkart 
I have tried the L-BFGS method in the neural-art code by @jcjohnson . 
It does work and return more stable results than Adam.
However, I find the optimization became a little slower.

Also, is there any way to probe at iteration progress (print stuff / generate checkpoint images using interval variables) like the original code does.
Since I find in the official comment doc that "variables subject to optimization are updated in-place at the end of optimization".
